author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 55-year-old history-sheeter, G. Rengasamy, was found murdered with head injuries and his head covered with a plastic bag at Muniyandipuram under Villur police station limits on Sunday.

Police said that the body was noticed around 5 a.m. near the house of his first wife, Pappathi, who is the vice-president of Thennammanallur village panchayat. Police sources said that he was last seen at 4.30 p.m. on Saturday when he left from the residence of his second wife.

A member of the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam, the deceased had a history-sheet in Villur police station since 2008. Rengasamy, a Dalit, was involved in real estate business. The police suspect that he could have been murdered elsewhere before the body was dumped at the spot. Similarly, the assailants had sprayed chilli powder on the body to divert the sniffer dog.

The police said that a business motive or personal enmity could be the reason for the murder. They have picked up some suspects for interrogation.
title: History-sheeter murdered
